intro: Helosciadium graveolens, commonly known as the stinking roselight, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its strong, unpleasant odor, it is often considered a weed in cultivated areas.
